description:

Our technology based client in Rocky Hill, CT is in need of hiring a Database Architect to join their core team!  The Database Architect is responsible for all aspects of development database deployment, data management, integrity and security. This includes functions such as Power BI development, modeling, data warehousing, as well as performance tuning, backups, system health and application support. Provide technical direction and database expertise for complex data repository challenges. 

This person will be spending about 25% of their time performing Database Administrative duties, 50% performing Datawarehouse and business information development duties, and the remaining 25% performing database development duties.

This role does require that the candidate be comfortable interfacing with end users a fair amount, ranging from the top of the org chart, to the bottom.

- Database design – 3rd normal form and Star modeling.
- Performance Monitoring and Tuning
- Work with cross functional teams to evaluate business requirements and determine appropriate/optimal solutions (including feasibility analysis, design, work estimates, user performance needs, testing strategies, development, operations management, and supportability).
- Daily monitoring of database backups and system health.
- Data warehouse design and maintenance.
- Power BI Report Authoring.
- Build/develop, test, and debug solutions.
- Work with SDLC processes for DB deployments, with off-hours support as needed.
- Engineer and maintain BI solutions.
- Perform other related duties as assigned.

Qualification Requirements for the Database Architect:

- To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
- 10-15 years of experience in the database space.
- Demonstrate a broad understanding of systems analysis principles, practices and procedures.
- Implement and define design patterns for various systems.
- Advanced knowledge of database structure and theory – specifically as implemented in SQL Server.
- Transact-SQL.
- Understanding of Disaster Recovery and High Available principles.
- SQL Server Reporting and Integration Services.
- Able to establish and adhere to goals, priorities, and objectives.
- Self-starter who seeks new challenges and responsibilities.
- Well-developed written and verbal communication skills.
- Comfortable to work in all phases of the lifecycle of a project.
- Exhibit excellent judgment and decision making.
- Able to give and receive feedback and criticism with a focus on self-improvement.
- Work well independently and with a team.
- Able to diagnose, escalate, and solve issues.
- Accurately develop work plans and execute them.

Education and other experience for the Database Architect:

- Bachelor’s degree or higher in Computer Engineering or related field of study.
- Master’s degree preferred, but not required.
- Minimum 5 years of experience as a Database Administrator.
- Working knowledge of the following is a plus: Sharepoint 365, C#, .NET, VB.NET, SVN, NoSQL, Azure SQL as a Service.

title: QA Engineer (Data Validation / SQL)
description:
Local candidates will only be considered

Position:  QA Tester (with Data Validation skills / SQL)

Location:  Lexington, MA

Term:  6 Month contract to start (historically, this client extends contracts - we have multiple consultants that continue to work for this client after 5+ years on assignment)

Pay Rate:  to $40.00 per hour w2 (without benefits) or $50.00 corp to corp per hour

This is an exciting opportunity to work in Lexington, MA with a leader in the healthcare industry!  Our client is looking to hire a QA Engineer to work alongside other Quality Assurance professionals. 

About the QA Engineer job:

- Writing test plans and test cases
- Web testing experience
- Must have at least intermediate SQL experience with a familiarity joining tables.  The SQL editors our client uses are Toad (for Oracle) and SQL Developer, although anyone familiar with other editors could easily learn to use these editors.  Also, someone with SQL Server experience could transfer their knowledge to Oracle.
Some automation experience would be a plus, but not required at this early stage.  For now, it is primarily running scripts, but modifying them is planned down the road.  The tool used is HP UFT, formerly known as QTP (Quick Test Professional).
- As far as XML files are concerned, they just use them to check the data output.  No special knowledge of or manipulating of XML is required.
- Bugs (defects) and test cases are logged to HP ALM (Quality Center), but this can be picked up in a few days and would not be a pre-requisite.
- Typically, QA is given either a business requirements document, but more normally a functional spec document and sometimes a technical spec document, which are reviewed at meetings with development.  Then, from these documents, test cases are written and reviewed.  The code is deployed, tested, and bugs logged.  After the QA sign-off generally a User Acceptance Test (UAT) is done, but in this case the users don’t do back end testing, so that QA presents the test results at a meeting instead.
- A lot of data analysis is involved, looking through the data to test.  And if these can’t be found, then QA helps developers to find suitable info that can be modified (mocked-up) for the tests and may write a simple script.  But QA does not run these scripts – that is done by the developers and DBAs.
- Finally, the plan is to not do so many mockups, but instead input the data in the front ends to the data warehouse.
compensation: $40.00 per hour w2 (without benefits) or $50.00 corp to corp per hour

title: Data Science Fellowship
description:
What is Pathrise
Pathrise (YC W18) invests in undervalued university students or young professionals by coaching them to get a competitive internship or job. The program is completely free upfront. In exchange, Pathrise fellows agree to pay back a share of their first year's salary if and only if they get hired.

Pathrise is based on insights from hundreds of hiring managers in tech; this means everyone from Google recruiters to startup CEOs. We've been featured in TechCrunch, VentureBeat, EdSurge, and The Atlantic as the "Y Combinator for your career." To date, we've worked with over 130 fellows and have helped them land offers at Facebook, Uber, Google, Oath, Amazon, and other top companies or exciting startups.

The Pathrise Fellowship is a program for students and new grads that helps you land the best job or internship possible in tech.

During the fellowship, you receive 1-on-1 mentorship from experienced industry engineers, analysts, managers, and recruiters. You learn systems to attract the attention of any company you want, find out insider information on how to ace your interviews, and more. We even directly refer you to companies in our network until you find a job you love.

We seek to uplift and provide guidance for undervalued students and young professionals in their early career. You can read more about our mission and how it all works on our website: www.pathrise.com.

You are either in university or within 5 years of graduation, and interested in getting the best possible job.

title: Inventor/Software/Hardware/Electronics/AI/Bio Developer
description:
SBIR FUNDING provides a team of experienced professionals who can assist with application for SBIR Phase 1, Phase 2, and Phase 3 grants as well as the administration of each award.  

We are seeking a software/systems/electronics/AI/biotech-medtech inventor possessing a unique product idea that requires  funding to commercialize.  Ideally, you are a student or professor who may not have the resources or time to take an idea forward and who seeks a team to help advance the idea to commercialization via federal SBIR seed funding program.   

SBIR is the Small Business Innovation Research program, a federally  funded alternative to raising venture or angel funding.  It is a government seed/grant program begun in 1982 that typically is awarded in 3  phases:  

1 ) Phase 1 – Up to $150-225K in non-dilutive funds for development of a prototype or proof of concept (6 months) 
2 ) Phase 2 – Up to $1-1.5M for implementation of commercialization of product (2 years) 
3 ) Phase 3 – Marketing stage development for the product  

A study commissioned by the National Academy of Sciences indicated that “SBIR awards provided $2.3B in research and seed funding in 2007.  In comparison, private venture markets provided $1.2B in seed stage funding (that year).”

The application and selection process is rigorous and money is awarded is allocated from 2.5% of 11 federal agencies’ external R&D budgets to fund R&D projects by small businesses to meet mission needs and commercialize the results of federally funded research.  A detailed summary of the program can  be found here:  

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Small_Business_Innovation_Research 

A detailed list of the participating agencies can be found here:

https://www.sbir.gov/about/about-sbir 

Approximately 30,000 applications are received annually for the DoD  SBIR with a 10% award success.  In 2004, the NIH awarded roughly 30% of Phase 1 grant applications.  This compares to a 2%  success rate which is typical for angel investors.  

The benefit of going  this route is that you do not have to give up a sizable share of equity as you might with VC or angel investment, and you do not have the repay the grant.  

Companies that have gone on to become successful having first applied  for SBIR funding include: Genzyme, Genentech, Amgen, Kurtzweil, Cubist, Vertex, et al.  

The trade off is that the application for SBIR funding is not easy.   Typically there is a 9-12 month review period from the time you submit  your application until a Phase 1 decision is made.  There is no cost to  submit a proposal but the paperwork and online systems setup required for the application process is tedious and exhaustive.  Without an  appropriate background, team and network of industry peer contacts to review and support your application, it is a difficult path to pursue.  

We are a team of experienced former gov’t researchers, entrepreneurs,  programmers, and consultants who are familiar with SBIR process and who  can provide support for an SBIR application, administration of the SBIR award and product development process to bring your idea to market.    

We can provide a primary investigator, a > 50% full time employee  required by SBIR grants, as well as support team to ensure successful  application and execution of a Phase 1 award. We can also help with the  application / execution of Phase 2 and Phase 3 awards.  In this manner,  you can focus your efforts on the key research or technical work to be  done as part of this project and not have to contend with the massive  reporting requirements that goes along with an award.  

You should ideally possess a unique idea, one that addresses a problem  for which no solution currently exists.  For example, a health or military related device or tool, product idea, software and/or electronic device (ie, IoT sensor/device, health related device/system, machine learning system, AI, Echo/Alexa, biotech, etc.).     Ideally, you  should also have developed a working prototype/POC of the product.   

As we are only able to work on one project at any given time, we are currently accepting new submissions for projects that have strong potential for  successful commercialization.  If we feel your product idea is a fit, we can agree to sign an NDA and determine whether an appropriate SBIR  request for proposal exists for your product.   Ultimately, if we feel  the project is worthy and worth pursuing we will offer a proposal  revenue/profit sharing agreement that is fair to both parties.

title: Scrum Master
description:
Do you have a few years of experience as a Certified ScrumMaster® (CSM®) under your belt? Does your project management experience run the gamut from traditional waterfall methodology to an Agile environment? Our 50-person Project Management Office team in Technology is looking for a scrum master: someone with the flexibility to work collaboratively and independently and who can be persuasive, motivating, and attentive to detail—while always keeping an eye on the big picture. Does that sound like you? Our scrum master will be working with multiple teams simultaneously, so a can-do attitude and the ability to handle several projects at once are essential qualities. 


Key responsibilities

Guiding the team on how to use Agile/Scrum practices and values while maintaining the Commonwealth culture and spirit
Facilitating Scrum meetings
Supporting the team through a servant leadership style
Working with the team and any external resources to help identify impediments and remove them
Facilitating communication with other teams as needed to address any cross-team dependencies
Monitoring progress against Commonwealth operational metrics
Working with the product owner to establish and review team-specific metrics designed to improve team performance (in addition to Commonwealth operational metrics)
Gaining a high-level understanding of the application(s) to the extent useful in serving other scrum master responsibilities
Participating with the product owner and business analyst in discussions around strategic planning, including vision, goals, and road maps
Ensuring that the team has the resources (i.e., people and tools) necessary for success
Organizing Agile/Scrum training workshops as needed
Attending the weekly scrum master “Scrum of Scrums” to report on team activities
Providing traditional project management support for projects as needed

Core strengths

3–5 years of experience as a scrum master; CSM® certification is a must
A strong desire to help the team succeed and do what is necessary to make it happen
Ability to work on multiple Scrum teams concurrently (usually no more than two)
Experience working independently, as well as in a team-oriented collaborative environment
Strong, clear communication skills (written, verbal, and presentation)
Ability to conform to shifting priorities, demands, and timelines through analytical and problem-solving capabilities
Persuasive, adaptable, encouraging, and motivating
An independent learner and self-starter
An eye for detail but able to see the big picture

While not required, experience with the following would be a plus:

Experience working with multiple Scrum teams on a single project
2-5 years of project management experience
A background in financial services


Have we piqued your curiosity? Can you see yourself thriving in this opportunity? Let's introduce ourselves.


About Commonwealth--and Our Anything but Common® Culture


Commonwealth Financial Network® is the largest privately held Registered Investment Adviser-independent broker/dealer in the U.S., with offices in Waltham, Massachusetts, and San Diego, California. Since 1979, we've been delivering indispensable service to independent financial professionals so they, in turn, can put their clients first. Our technology, research, resources, and support--plus a variety of affiliation models--deliver what today's independent advisors need to thrive.


That being said, we are a financial services company with a unique mission--one that encompasses purpose, vision, and core values in equal measure. Staying true to these guiding principles is the reason we are recognized so often and by so many for the quality of life we enjoy here. We believe it directly translates to a better experience for everyone: employees, advisors, clients, and our communities.


Creating a supportive culture where everyone can thrive is a mission we take seriously. From professional development to comprehensive benefits, grassroots leadership opportunities, generous bonus and stock option incentive plans, opportunities to unwind and connect, and so much more, Commonwealth is not just a great place to work--it's a place that, for many, feels like home.


Commonwealth Financial Network® is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to a diverse workforce.

title: Full Stack Developer for Rapidly Growing Medical Device Company
description:
We are a four-year-old medical technology company founded by a team of accomplished entrepreneurs that have built multiple successful companies, including two that we took public on the NASDAQ.  

This company is growing rapidly and has been well funded, having raised $13.4 million dollars to date.  
We have created and patented a revolutionary orthopedic rehabilitation device.  Response to the new device has been very strong, with endorsement by 126 highly respected surgeons nationwide.  First versions of the device have been sold into more than 75 hospitals and clinics including many of the top 20 facilities in the country.  

We are now nearing completion of our second product, a portable version of our first flagship device.  A growing list of surgeons are pre-ordering the product in anticipation of launch this spring.

The new product features wearable devices for measuring and tracking patient progress.

We are currently looking for a Full Stack Developer to help assist us with development of our patient-focused mobile applications, website and portals. The initial project is a 4-8 week project, with potential for long-term opportunity for the right candidate. Candidates based in Boston are a plus, as we would like for this person to come to our location 1-2 times per week for a few weeks. 

We will also consider candidates from the CT/NY/NJ region who can travel to us in Nashua, NH. 

    THIS POSITION IS FOR IMMEDIATE HIRE.

Requirements are:
•	Track record of successfully delivering web-based solutions as a full stack developer
•	Strong programming foundation, programming skills and deep familiarity with computer science topics including data structures and algorithms
•	Keen sense of the risks, rewards and trade-offs when making technical decisions
•	Ability to identify opportunities to improve the team’s processes and practices
•	Total ownership over the quality of their work and fluency in development practices that minimize bugs, through UI testing and unit testing.
•	Very strong sense UX best practices and strong appreciation for UI design. Further, enjoys working as part of a internal UI/UX product team to create experiences that delight our customers
•	Ability to work in a fast-paced Agile environment
•	Strong sense of urgency and effective prioritization. We are a deadline driven organization.  
 
Skills Required:
•	6+ years of professional experience as a hands-on developer 
•	Proven experience programming in Front End technologies, such as HTML, CSS, Javascript, ReactJS, and React Native (front)
•	SASS or other CSS preprocessor programming experience
•	2+ year’s experience creating apps and web-apps using React and React Native. 
•	Implements Scrum/Agile methodologies
•	Bachelor’s degree (MIS or Computer Science emphasis) or equivalent experience
•	Experience with Back-end development (including database creation and management and web-storage) 
•	GitHub experience
•	Web Server experience (AWS,Nginx, Apache and etc.)

We are an early stage, entrepreneurial company.  The right candidate will be comfortable working with a small team and have a good balance of “doing things right” (quality, experience) and thinking outside the box / flexibility.  
Qualified candidates, please respond and include:
1.	A cover letter detailing why you are the ideal fit for this job 
2.	An up-to-date resume 

Candidates who send resumes without the requested cover letter will not be considered.

Finally, openness, honesty, and candidness are qualities we respond to—as opposed to framing things in the right way with the right words. Please be who you are and let the dice roll.

title: Certification Specialist
description:
Certification Specialist
Full time Position – Kanata, Ontario

WannLynx is looking for a certification specialist to join the team.  

This is a great job if you have a business degree, comfortable with technology, great at project management and want to play a significant role with a small, intensely skilled team. You will play a crucial role in getting our development certified and in the field. This means you will take on significant responsibility and must be able to handle projects independently.

Our focus is initially convenience stores and truck stops in the US.  We are developing a payment application, FuelLynx, to take transactions securely from the payment terminal to the host.  In parallel, we are developing a management server, QuikLynx, that will be used for installing/supporting the payment terminal and to generate diagnostics/statistics.  QuikLynx will also be used to collect cardholder information and to deliver stored messages to the terminals based on customers’ profiles.  With time, AI and machine learning will be used to further segment cardholders and their preferences. 

WannLynx is led by a serial entrepreneur who introduced EMV secure payments to retail/restaurants in Canada and the US over the past 20 years, and is now focusing on US petroleum with a market potential of $4 billion.

•	Complete required internal and external reports related to certification
•	Maintain all certification documents and certificates
•	Participate in integration, integration test and software verification test cycles. Activities will include setting up test environments, test case execution, problem report management and collection of relevant metrics.

•	Interact with product management, operations and software designers
